area_name: Blob Buttress and Smith's Rock, The

climbs.name: Smith's Rock free-standing summit
climbs.fa: Greg Collins, Reave Castenholtz via Yellow Fever 5.10X

content.description:
West Face, Original: Yellow Fever; 5.10- X Description; boulder up to single 1/4" hand drilled, free lead bolt, then boulder to summit.

Big Alaskan Drunk: 5.10b *** sport. Description; power wobble up SW arete' w/excellent pro.

Ultra Violet: 5.12b *** Bolts up N face bolts up center of face; good onsight.

Nuclear Warm Up; 5.11b/c ** S face, sport. cool, but less cool than N face.
content.location:
200m S. of Blob Buttress.

The wall behind, west, of Smith's Rock are several cracks like Papoli: 5.10c * rattly hands and "mixed" like Nuclear Power Surge: 5.13 *

content.description: Small, steep, free standing pinnacle. Seldom climbed and difficult. 2 routes on the Needle; Free Radicle 5.10+ R, description: boulder up to brake in west face, shortest, clip single 1/4" hand drilled, free lead, placed bolt and crank then mantle onto the summit. South Face; 5.11- R Thin cracks on south face, pitons maybe necessary.
content.protection: Very little protection to be had on the pinnacle, mostly thin.
content.location: 19 m free standing pinnacle high above the Blob Buttress NE of Split Rock

content.description: Distinctive Summit, Needle, with summit register. Similar in shape to the Moai stones of Easter Island. Climb it; before it blows over. A short route from the west notch, stepping out right onto an exposed face, with right facing flake and cracks to 2 m diameter summit, A couple of fixed pins, maybe. Rappel from slings and fixed gear. For a longer climb; climb nice south facing 5.8 stem chimney into regular route.
content.protection: small Trad rack, mostly thin-fingers, 1 set.
content.location: Obvious pinnacle on skyline above, west, of Blob Buttress, East of Split Rock.

pathTokens: Blob Buttress and Smith's Rock, The
